385DE287CFAA493CB259D207C95E8485.description:
With modeling,
guidance, and support, express
thoughts, feelings, and ideas through
speaking.

36AFD7C308D74431B05146C0E3ACC397.description:
Adapt speech to a variety of contents and communicative tasks, demonstrating command of formal
English when indicated or appropriate.

8AC2B0172869426894D4E556887E6B69.description:
Create representations
and extensions of experiences or
stories through writing, drawing, and
open-ended materials in centers,
and discuss them with others.

E617DFB25F2540C8A7F65E4FD6CE1485.description:
Make strategic use of digital media and visual displays of data to express information and enhance
understanding of presentations.

2FB7D21F3DC44DBA9793D51DC8DD598D.description:
Describe familiar people,
places, things, and events, and, with
prompting and support, provide
additional detail.

CB2F276C781E41438BC0CDA7D0A20067.description:
Present information, findings, and supporting evidence such that listeners can follow the line of
reasoning; the organization, development, and style are appropriate to task, purpose, and audience.

B3944FF73372461EA8B1D642F82990D5.description: Speaking and Listening Standards Presentation of Knowledge and Ideas

3DD3FB1EC4964C6AA246D4715BF61B5E.description:
With prompting and
support, ask and answer questions
about what a speaker says in order
to seek help, get information, or
clarify something that is not
understood.

8FC5529692D748FD8DAFB2A1E1F1D44F.description: Evaluate a speaker’s point of view, reasoning, and use of evidence and rhetoric.

C95999C039A84219B5C8E3467CC57FCE.description:
Confirm understanding
of a text read aloud or information
presented orally or through other
media by asking and answering
questions about key details, or by
retelling, acting out, or representing
key details through work in centers.

2F16675366EE452D9F5E0FDBDF3DAD12.description:
Integrate and evaluate information presented in diverse media formats, such as visual, quantitative,
and oral formats.

A3590F14FBD74957AA1993B8C7368C7A.description:
Demonstrate appropriate
conversational interactions including
taking turns, listening, speaking,
answering questions, and wait time.

9169168DCB9B429A98C699FB64F47AE2.description:
Participate with varied
peers and adults in collaborative
conversations across activities
throughout the day.

D555928D46634F59A7E9FA8CBCDB619F.description:
Prepare for and participate effectively in a range of conversations and collaborations with varied
partners, building on others’ ideas and expressing their own clearly and persuasively.

7CE30C95736F4790A3761462A2CBBD04.description: Speaking and Listening Standards Comprehension and Collaboration

B0C202BC6720480FBE0D050C30B0C0F5.description:
With modeling, guidance, and support
from adults, engage routinely in drawing, dictating,
and emergent writing activities for a range of tasks,
purposes, and audiences.

5B9F37C24015493497429082FCBD2165.description:
Write routinely over extended time frames (time for research, reflection, and revision) and shorter
time frames (a single sitting or a day or two) for a range of tasks, purposes, and audiences.

CBAD1EC7B18F40AFA2335AE14D023E9B.description: Draw evidence from literary or informational texts to support analysis, reflection, and research.

32C92B8253B341B0AC76B477CB664A4F.description:
With modeling, guidance, and support
from adults, recall information from experiences or
gather information from provided sources to answer a
question.

B133614D8FEB42E2892044952D5ED869.description:
Integrate relevant and credible information from multiple print and digital sources while avoiding
plagiarism.

67BAA02CC6534549B1FBD53B8CB6DB31.description:
With modeling, guidance, and support,
participate in shared research and writing projects,
such as reading a number of books by a favorite
author and expressing opinions about them.

6ACB8E803DD24E38B84F5B1E2ECC1BB6.description:
Conduct short but more sustained research projects based on focus questions, demonstrating new
understanding of the subject under investigation.

CD26E33E359441FD95471F4F41E36CBB.description: Writing Standards Research to Build and Present Knowledge

EBE89CFE95E145C8A55879B1F84B6039.description:
Use technology, including the Internet, to produce and publish writing and to interact and collaborate
with others.

FB01F80000B54D1A9FB5533BB00D46A6.description:
With guidance and support from adults,
respond to questions and suggestions from others
and add details to strengthen drawing, dictating
and/or emergent writing as needed.

AB2024F857614EE4BE475235CD07BE2F.description:
Develop and strengthen writing as needed by planning, revising, editing, rewriting, or trying a new
approach.

3D3605F50F7B41869B11DCD600BF9842.description:
With modeling, guidance, and support,
produce clear and coherent writing in which the
development and organization are appropriate to
task, purpose, and audience. (Grade-specific
expectations for writing types are defined in
standards 1-3 above.)

4B41F47001E24E8A9860337D591FDE73.description:
Produce clear and coherent writing in which the development and organization are appropriate to
task, purpose, and audience.

D9EE16ED53B04DEE9AAA9C9DD139A31C.description: Writing Standards Production and Distribution of Writing

404824F54E0146068658B0EDD33FA970.description:
With modeling, prompting, and support,
use a combination of drawing, dictating, and/or
emergent writing to narrate a single event.

02479897A9FD41C8B93928AF38EEF0E7.description: Write narratives to develop real or imagined experiences or events using effective techniques, well-chosen details, and well-structured event sequences.

37F4CA0770414146B963AB969F67256E.description:
With modeling, prompting, and support,
use a combination of drawing, dictating, and/or
emergent writing to explain information about a
familiar topic or informational text.

6A040A366AE64F3D8DBFC9FCAF408715.description:
Write information/explanatory texts to examine and convey complex ideas and information clearly
and accurately through the effective selection, organization, and analysis of content.

EDD4ADC4317C487ABA341CC7B33D0F78.description:
With modeling, prompting, and support,
use a combination of drawing, dictating, and/or
emergent writing to express a preference, opinion, or
idea about a specific topic or text.

AF789E494A3447EBA85A6C1AC49C8A52.description:
Write arguments to support claims in an analysis of substantive topics or texts, using valid reasoning
and relevant and sufficient evidence.

6C3EC8E2CB2543C184586AEC844E10D7.description: Writing Standards Text Types and Protocol

6F683BDAE7C7407AA7D28F425B2A0286.description:
Use words and phrases acquired through
conversations, being read to, and responding to texts.

841ECDB77E674FF2B3A04BE46D0DD7CF.description:
Distinguish shades of meaning among familiar
verbs describing the same general action. (i.e.,
jog/sprint)

9123CF14A90A4B329656C1DA977403A5.description:
Make real-life connections between words and
their use.

AB6E167471B24AFAA5EB0A6F8D802051.description:
Demonstrate understanding of frequently
occurring verbs and adjectives.

17B6D5A5BAA44AC185B244FC7E4F7B5E.description:
Sort common objects into categories to gain a
sense of the concepts the categories represent.

F7C5A2763B6A4C8DBD154C3C6832CA6E.description:
With guidance and support from adults,
explore word relationships and nuances in word
meanings.

8A290929F01E40909F8B475A83A7B49C.description:
Determine or clarify the meaning of
unknown and multiple-meaning words and phrases
based on pre-K conversations, reading, and content.
(1) Identify new meanings for familiar words and
apply them accurately.
(2) Use the most frequently occurring inflections and
affixes as a clue to the meaning of an unknown word.

888EC994F7B64D8FB82B943F91DD2C4F.description:
Determine or clarify the meaning of unknown and multiple-meaning words and phrases by using
context clues, analyzing meaningful word parts, and consulting general and specialized reference
materials, as appropriate.

F2D8A910AF1C48ED8B4F36716936D30B.description:
Begin to recognize that a name begins with a capital
letter.

A9A1498E682D444E9D1F94A37E747BF5.description:
With prompting and support, produce and expand
complete sentences in shared language activities.

4169D4CB228E40359D6AC1FF3C5DD4EF.description:
With prompting and support, use the most
frequently occurring prepositions when speaking and
in shared language activities.

B7B6E70BB2A54032A7BCE6DF12E4DF08.description:
Understand and use question words (interrogatives)
when speaking and in shared language activities.

2A92AEF9A9CB4217818FD5E261C73855.description:
Form regular plural nouns when speaking and in
shared language activities.

BC13832AD38A43ED833C560CFBEE6E81.description:
Use frequently occurring nouns and verbs when
speaking and in shared language activities.

876021724312449EA473034F923A9AD7.description:
Follow one-to-one correspondence between voice
and print when writing a sentence or sentence
fragment, or when rereading a dictated sentence.

FF17CE79847B45FBBC4F141F455BFB95.description:
With modeling or verbal prompts, orally produce
complete sentences.

C6930F26814D4118A81303F9348B6C99.description:
Demonstrate command of the conventions of
standard English grammar and usage when speaking,
and conventions of standard English grammar and
usage, including capitalization and punctuation, when
writing with adult modeling, guidance, and support.

DBA844E2C24441D1A37678E786397481.description:
Demonstrate command of the conventions of standard English grammar and usage when speaking
and conventions of standard English grammar and usage, including capitalization and punctuation,
when writing.

227D6E4D75784ED5B2A0540B6E38863E.description:
Use illustrations to retell story events in familiar
picture books.

E44D29D553184D77A5A2789B6E731902.description: Interact with text to support comprehension.

6210450D1C664F988BB6FF9C3EF9A0BE.description: Read with sufficient accuracy and fluency to support comprehension.

03133BFA64854F66B15CDBCD7D71C9E9.description:
Begin to print the distinctive features of letter forms
(circle, line, diagonal, crossed lines, etc.).

43C8BF4F26114D878E90DEB43F44583E.description:
Begin to recognize the difference between upper
and lowercase letters.

E35A70BDF7A1408E9461255C7AA7828E.description:
Know and apply grade-level phonics and
word analysis skills when encoding words.

D156757DF82D497CAAB3E9E73C0B78BC.description: Know and apply grade-level phonics and word analysis skills when encoding words; write legibly.

AF82F9800A434750BB07AA9B0667406A.description: Begin to decode regularly spelled CVC words.

74DFB3D38DA94F6D8335E7E39BAC0C66.description:
Recognize high-frequency words by sight, including
own name and other familiar words in the
environment

21F67DDEAB52436EA0C8C2CB241C6AFF.description:
Begin to demonstrate knowledge of one-to-one
letter sound correspondence by producing the most
frequent sound for familiar consonants.

7746247D9A5B4AEF9DC90382DC5E0D87.description:
Know and apply grade-level phonics and
word analysis skills when decoding isolated words and
in connected text.

A06E8149FBB641E59939859FC3A338D9.description:
Know and apply grade-level phonics and word analysis skills when decoding isolated words and in
connected text.

6A5C64029BA946A3B7182E0E80FD8B48.description: Foundational Literacy Standards Phonics and Word Recognition

577406679DA14533B656437D678D78CC.description:
Identify whether or not two words begin or end with
the same sound.

DC025E65EF1B4B6FB70E2C7EBB5EC798.description:
Begin to isolate and pronounce the initial, final,
and/or medial vowel sounds (phonemes) in two- and
three-phoneme (VC or CVC) words, excluding CVC
words ending with /l/, /r/, or /x/.

3228AD32CCCD4036811C7FE3ED844C48.description:
Begin to blend and segment onsets and rhymes of
single-syllable spoken words.

ECC6B256F4FA4B45A4B6841B0FB41172.description:
Begin to pronounce and identify syllables in familiar
words and words in a sentence.

AD6F09C8BC8C42FEB7E92B0E124B3925.description:
Recognize and discriminate between rhyming words
in spoken language.

6354911B6EE24FFD9F1194A454691DAB.description:
Demonstrate increasing understanding of
spoken words, syllables, and sounds (phonemes)
through oral language and with guidance and support.

53254DE5DCC347D28AFBE3AC6B4070E3.description: Demonstrate understanding of spoken words, syllables, and sounds (phonemes).

310C843B8D5C476C9E933200A2759A5E.description:
Recognize familiar uppercase letters and some of
the most common lowercase letters.

3BC4C4E38F534EF69B99EC5EC38F3CF1.description:
With guidance and support, understand that words
are made up of alphabet letters.

F46D80B8663C43EABE0790BF2D72452B.description:
Recognize that spoken words can be written and
read.

199578946FC04E16AE92C3C07F3336BA.description:
Handle books appropriately, right-side-up, turning
pages one at a time, and front to back.

79C68AC0AA9C4148864B6D87244069FD.description:
Demonstrate understanding of the
organization and basic features of print.

D844BE4C280E4CD098DBFE028333D7B6.description: Demonstrate understanding of the organization and basic features of print.

0110D8D4764344DEA36B4D6429221F04.description:
Listen and respond to stories and
poems of appropriate complexity for pre-K.

0727AB5C4A3940B88F56D514EA78D3B9.description:
Listen and respond to informational
texts of appropriate complexity for pre-K.

51E74A6408B54177A0F6EE3108E1F8E1.description: Read and comprehend complex literary and informational texts independently and proficiently.

8F2D2BC1399D441C860C0D39708AD5E6.description: Reading Standards Range of Reading and Level of Text Complexity

68AB9C87F23B4376B053E75802B83D17.description:
With prompting and support, orally
compare and contrast the experiences of characters in
a story to personal experience or to the experiences
of characters in another familiar story.

E87F5073DB504A4B8D2618C7A5F7FAFA.description:
With prompting and support, orally
identify basic similarities and differences between two
texts on the same topic.

5B1611ADAE844169A180984F5D722AFC.description:
Analyze how two or more texts address similar themes or topics in order to build knowledge or to
compare the approaches an author takes.

E2CFAC2E01DA4890A95A8830B537BA69.description:
Delineate and evaluate the argument and specific claims in a text, including the validity of the
reasoning as well as the relevance and sufficiency of evidence.

958A89DC253C492D90B58C709298ED38.description:
With prompting and support, orally
describe the relationship between illustrations and the
story in which they appear.

7CCCA54BF73E4306B041A451BA7EEE84.description:
With prompting and support, orally
describe the relationship between illustrations and the
text in which they appear.

18E63806A936445BBBE265D94831EC7A.description: Assess how point of view or purpose shapes the content and style of a text.

5D453119101F46D1B959A2658D8AE733.description: Reading Standards Integration of Knowledge and Ideas

C86140D155C1486AB6BC750B26E0F48D.description:
With prompting and support, answer
questions about who is telling a story.

D86928582A3A408C9401DF28A3A17056.description:
With prompting and support, answer
questions about who is presenting ideas or
information in a text.

828971FEC1A24453909BFB3CCD3C2918.description: Assess how point of view or purpose shapes the content and style of a text.

DC6D2A979BED43B3B9477C0963554F3E.description:
Analyze the structure of texts, including how specific sentences, paragraphs, and larger portions of a
text (e.g., a section, chapter, scene, or stanza) relate to each other and the whole.

F482C7E80C614E2F86E416C6894AE1DD.description:
With prompting and support, respond to
questions about the meaning of unknown words in a
story.

AA31697D8CCD4365BFF882A57C0E84E2.description:
With prompting and support, answer
questions about the meaning of words and phrases in
a text relevant to pre-K topic or subject area.

C4A0647A21C248519CAF94564177AD45.description:
Interpret words and phrases as they are used in a text, including technical, connotative, and
figurative meanings, and analyze how specific word choices shape meaning or tone.

E172BECBD71648E9A2C5A063934F217E.description:
With prompting and support, orally
identify characters, settings, and events from a familiar
story.

A4BC6CA2B96B404CA017A0A72B3FACE7.description:
With prompting and support, orally
identify the connection between information in a text
to personal experience or other text.

D59BA842C8EA4F66ACED4EB715CDC73E.description: Analyze how and why individuals, events, and ideas develop and interact over the course of a text.

866AA8C8CA344AA590A0692B13CC03F1.description:
With prompting and support, orally retell
familiar stories including details.

EA0F13BCA3824FD3B4885265F6BDFE20.description:
With prompting and support, orally
identify a main topic and retell details of texts,
discussions, and activities.

B4F7CACDA5714AF39A8442CFAB15A7FB.description:
Determine central ideas or themes of a text, analyze their development, and summarize the key
supporting details and ideas.

13E2A9191732449584338960BD22E055.description:
With modeling, prompting, and support,
ask, and answer questions about a story read aloud.

BEB6E5174B424481ACCD30225DEA2C90.description:
With modeling, prompting, and support,
ask and answer questions about informational text
read aloud.

5977596046C345419D7B2A9457444A2E.description: Read closely to determine what a text says explicitly and to make logical inferences from it; cite specific textual evidence when writing or speaking to support conclusions drawn from the text.

14557A82D7734D81B976CF200F2AD0B9.description: Reading Standards Key Ideas and Details:
